assignments.name: Homework 0
assignments.description: In-class assignment. Homework involves problem-solving, mathematical modeling, and design. It is expected to be completed neatly, scanned, and uploaded to Canvas. Collaboration is encouraged, but submit your own work. Graded for completion; late homework is not accepted.

assignments.name: Group Project
assignments.description: A group project will be due on the Friday of finals week. Further details will be provided in class.

exams.name: Midterm 1
exams.description: Midterm exam covering weeks 1-3. Exams consist of 5 to 6 questions to be completed in approximately 1 hour and 15 minutes. Questions will be similar to homework, class, and book examples.

exams.name: Midterm 2
exams.description: Midterm exam covering weeks 5-7. Exams consist of 5 to 6 questions to be completed in approximately 1 hour and 15 minutes. Questions will be similar to homework, class, and book examples.

exams.name: Midterm 3
exams.description: Midterm exam covering weeks 9-10. Exams consist of 5 to 6 questions to be completed in approximately 1 hour and 15 minutes. Questions will be similar to homework, class, and book examples.

exams.name: Final Exam
exams.description: The final exam will be held on MONDAY, DECEMBER 9th from 7:30 pm to 10:00 pm in room 61-2311. The exam is comprehensive.

lectures.name: Week 1: L1 - General Principles
lectures.description: Introduction to the course and fundamental concepts of mechanics (Chapter 1).

lectures.name: Week 1: L2 - Force Vectors
lectures.description: Covering Scalars and Vectors, Vector Operations, Vector Addition of Forces, and Addition of Coplanar Forces (Chapters 2.1-2.4).

lectures.name: Week 2: Holiday
lectures.description: No class session due to holiday.

lectures.name: Week 2: L3 - Cartesian Vectors & Position Vectors
lectures.description: Covering Cartesian Vectors, Addition of Cartesian Vectors, Position Vectors, Line Force Vectors, and Dot Product (Chapters 2.5-2.9).

lectures.name: Week 3: L4 & L5 - Equilibrium of a Particle
lectures.description: Covering Equilibrium of Particle, FBD of Particle, Coplanar Forces, and 3-D Force systems (Chapters 3.1-3.4).

lectures.name: Week 4: Midterm 1 Review & Exam
lectures.description: Review session for Midterm 1, followed by the exam during the second class meeting of the week.

lectures.name: Week 5: L7 & L8 - Moments
lectures.description: Covering Scalar Moments, Principle of Moments, Cross Product, Vector Moments About a Point-3D, and Vector Moments About an Axis-3D (Chapters 4.1-4.5).

lectures.name: Week 6: L9 - Moment of a Couple & Force-Couple Systems
lectures.description: Covering Moment of a Couple and how to Simplify Force and Couple systems (Chapters 4.6-4.7).

lectures.name: Week 7: L10, L11 & L12 - Equilibrium of a Rigid Body
lectures.description: Covering Distributed Loading, Equilibrium of a Rigid Body, FBD of Rigid Body, Equations of Equilibrium, 2 and 3 Force Members, and Constraints and Determinacy (Chapters 4.8-4.9, 5.1-5.7).

lectures.name: Week 8: Midterm 2 Review & Exam
lectures.description: Review session for Midterm 2, followed by the exam during the second class meeting of the week.

lectures.name: Week 9: L13 & L14 - Structural Analysis: Trusses
lectures.description: Analysis of Trusses using Method of Joints (MOJ), identifying Zero Force Members, and using Method of Sections (MOS) (Chapters 6.1-6.4).

lectures.name: Week 10: L15 & L16 - Structural Analysis: Frames and Machines
Week 11: Midterm 3 Review & Exam
lectures.description: Review session for Midterm 3 and project introduction, followed by the exam during the second class meeting of the week.

lectures.name: Week 12: L17a & L17b - Internal Forces
lectures.description: Determining Internal Loadings and creating Shear and Moment Diagrams for beams, including those with distributed loading (Chapters 7.1-7.3).

lectures.name: Week 13: L18 & L19 - Friction
lectures.description: Analysis of Dry Friction problems, including Wedges, Screws, and Belts (Chapters 8.1-8.5).

lectures.name: Week 14: Project Work
lectures.description: In-class time for project build and demonstration.

lectures.name: Week 15: L20 & L21 - Center of Gravity, Centroid, and Moment of Inertia
lectures.description: Calculating Center of Gravity, Centroid, and Moment of Inertia for composite bodies using the Parallel-Axis Theorem (Chapters 9.1-9.2, 10.1-10.2).

lectures.name: Week 16: Final Review
lectures.description: Review for the final exam. Covering Moment of Inertia for Composite Areas (Chapter 10.4).

contact_information.office_hours: 6:30 pm MW before class and 8:25 MW after class

course_expectations: Access Canvas daily for information, notes, and assignments for this course.
Attend and participate in class by asking questions, answering questions, collaborating appropriately in all project and problem-solving activities.

Take course notes, read, and view supplemental materials before class and after class, paying attention as you go until you understand everything that was presented in class, and can solve all the example problems.
Complete all assignments and submit them by the due date.
Get together with other students and come to office hours to clarify what is not clear and to work on additional problems.
Complete your work on exams, homework, supplemental problems, and projects neatly and clearly. If I cannot read it, then I cannot grade it.
Master understanding the material in this class. You understand the material when you can teach it to someone else.
